title: Missleading diagnostics when forgetting to add trait bound in impl block

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: [playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=e23f8b9715718a9cf5aa433a07575efa)

```rust
trait Foo {}
trait Bar {}

impl<T> Bar for T where T: Foo {}  // <----- This seems to confuse the compiler

struct Baz<T: Bar> {
    bar: T,
}

impl<T> Baz<T> {  // <----------- Notice missing T: Bar
    fn new(bar: T) -> Self {
        Baz {
            bar,
        }
    }
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `T: Foo` is not satisfied
  --> src/lib.rs:10:9
   |
10 | impl<T> Baz<T> {
   |         ^^^^^^ the trait `Foo` is not implemented for `T`
   |
note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `Bar` for `T`
  --> src/lib.rs:4:9
   |
4  | impl<T> Bar for T where T: Foo {}
   |         ^^^     ^
note: required by a bound in `Baz`
  --> src/lib.rs:6:15
   |
6  | struct Baz<T: Bar> {
   |               ^^^ required by this bound in `Baz`
help: consider restricting type parameter `T`
   |
10 | impl<T: Foo> Baz<T> {
   |       +++++
```

Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `T: Bar` is not satisfied
  --> src/lib.rs:10:9
   |
10 | impl<T> Baz<T> {
   |         ^^^^^^ the trait `Bar` is not implemented for `T`
   |
note: required by a bound in `Baz`
  --> src/lib.rs:6:15
   |
6  | struct Baz<T: Bar> {
   |               ^^^ required by this bound in `Baz`
help: consider restricting type parameter `T`
   |
10 | impl<T: Bar> Baz<T> {
   |       +++++

```

The current message is misleading because `Baz` doesn't *require* `Foo` and suggesting bounding by `Foo` causes the bound to be more restrictive than needed. At first I didn't even realize the bound was missing, I thought I added `Bar: Foo` by accident.
If I, hypothetically, truly wanted `T: Foo`, presumably because of some method implemented on `Foo` the proper error would still show up later, which is good.

Same on nightly.
